venue.name: Parking area near the power lines

item.description:
According to the Plymouth Antiquarian Society, "Everyone knows Plymouth Rock, but how many have visited Plymouth's other historic rock? Sacrifice Rock on Old Sandwich Road is the Antiquarian Society's oldest and perhaps least known historic site. Centuries before the arrival of English settlers to the area, this ancient landmark was an important stop for wayfarers. Travelers left small branches or stones atop the rock perhaps as a gesture of sacrifice, or to receive the blessing of safe passage -- the full meaning of the custom is shrouded by time. "

Visit the Plymouth Antiquarian Society website for more info about Sacrifice Rock and other historic Plymouth properties. The Wicked Yankee blog touched on Sacrifice Rock and another similar rock Chamber Rock in Bournedale. It was also featured on "Creepy Places in New England", featuring an attempted interview with the spirits.

Sacrifice Rock is not on our actual hike but we will pass it on the way and may make a brief stop after the hike-- if there is any interest.  It is listed as being along Old Sandwich Road near Sacrifice Rock Road-- at 394 Old Sandwich Road.

For the hike--there is a parking area near the power lines on Old Sandwich Road.  (I estimated the approximate street address of 147 Old Sandwich Road using Google maps but it may be off just a bit. Our hike will be about 2 hours. As you might expect, the Pine Hills are hilly!  Wear good shoes and bring water / snacks/ sun&bug stuff.

Breakfast at 8:30 at Metro's Cafe on 3A in Plymouth. All are welcome to join us.

group.name: Friends of Myles Standish State Forest Meetup Group

item.name: Pine Hills and Sacrifice Rock
